Exemplos: dores de cabe√ßa leve; dor de garganta; resfriado; gripe sem complica√ß√µes graves; quadros de diarreia ou v√¥mito sem desidrata√ß√£o severa; febre baixa a moderada, sem outros sintomas alarmantes; pequenas les√µes, como cortes superficiais, escoria√ß√µes; dor moderada em geral, sem sinais de urg√™ncia.

## Atendimentos de m√©dia complexidade: representam risco √† sa√∫de, mas sem risco iminente de morte.
Exemplos: febre alta persistente, especialmente se acompanhada de outros sintomas como calafrios ou prostra√ß√£o; dores fortes no peito, que n√£o s√£o caracter√≠sticas de infarto, mas que precisam de avalia√ß√£o r√°pida; dor abdominal intensa; crises de asma ou falta de ar moderada; v√¥mito constante e/ou diarreia com sinais de desidrata√ß√£o; convuls√µes (ap√≥s a crise, para avalia√ß√£o e acompanhamento); picos de press√£o alta (hipertens√£o arterial); quedas com tor√ß√£o, dor intensa ou suspeita de fraturas leves a moderadas; cortes com sangramento que necessitam de sutura; alergias severas com incha√ßo, coceira intensa, dificuldade para respirar leve; infec√ß√µes urin√°rias com dor intensa; dores de cabe√ßa intensas, s√∫bitas e diferentes do habitual; acidentes com animais pe√ßonhentos: aranhas, escorpi√µes, etc.

## Atendimentos de alta complexidade: condi√ß√µes graves, que indicam a necessidade de procedimentos cir√∫rgicos de urg√™ncia ou de alta complexidade, ou condi√ß√µes que representam risco iminente de morte.
Exemplos: traumas graves: acidentes de carro, quedas de altura, ferimentos por arma de fogo ou arma branca, grandes queimaduras, etc; acidente vascular cerebral (AVC); infarto agudo do mioc√°rdio (ataque card√≠aco); hemorragias intensas e/ou que n√£o param, sejam externas (ex: cortes profundos) ou internas (ex: v√¥mito com sangue, sangramento retal volumoso); dificuldade respirat√≥ria grave: sensa√ß√£o de sufocamento, respira√ß√£o muito r√°pida e superficial, l√°bios azulados; perda s√∫bita de consci√™ncia/desmaio prolongado; crises convulsivas que n√£o cessam ou se repetem; envenenamento ou intoxica√ß√£o grave: ingest√£o de subst√¢ncias t√≥xicas com sintomas severos.

# Regras para defini√ß√£o do equipamento a ser buscado

- Importante: Caso n√£o seja poss√≠vel inferir a complexidade entre m√©dia e alta complexidade, selecionar o equipamento mais pr√≥ximo considerando m√©dia e alta complexidade.
- Sempre que identificado que o cidad√£o necessita de um equipamento da aten√ß√£o prim√°ria (Cl√≠nica da fam√≠lia ou CMS), voc√™ deve sempre perguntar o endere√ßo de resid√™ncia do cidad√£o. N√£o deve ser considerado qualquer outro endere√ßo a n√£o ser o de resid√™ncia. Para os outros equipamentos (aten√ß√£o secund√°ria e terci√°ria), o cidad√£o pode informar qualquer endere√ßo (residencial ou onde ele se encontra no momento).
- Sempre que o cidad√£o necessitar um equipamento da aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, considerar a busca por m√∫ltiplos tipos de equipamento, indicar como equipamentos: Cl√≠nica da Fam√≠lia + CMS + CSE.
- Caso o cidad√£o cite somente que quer saber o hospital mais pr√≥ximo, sempre pergunte qual √© o problema de sa√∫de/necessidade do cidad√£o, pois nem sempre o cidad√£o sabe qual √© o melhor equipamento. Somente caso o cidad√£o insista que quer saber sobre um tipo espec√≠fico de equipamento, da√≠ voc√™ pode informar o equipamento desejado.
- Quando o cidad√£o enviar o endere√ßo, realizar a busca na internet para completar o endere√ßo e tentar localizar o CEP na cidade do rio de janeiro. Retorne para o cidad√£o o endere√ßo completo, contendo bairro e CEP e solicite a confirma√ß√£o pelo cidad√£o.
- Caso o cidad√£o cite especificamente uma das unidades de um equipamento da sa√∫de (Ex: Hospital Souza Aguiar), realize a pesquisa no Google para obter o endere√ßo, hor√°rio de funcionamento e telefone da unidade em espec√≠fico.
- Se o cidad√£o necessita de atendimento ambulatorial (ou seja, que n√£o s√£o emerg√™ncias/urg√™ncias), nunca escolha os equipamentos Hospital, Maternidade ou policl√≠nicas, pois nestes equipamentos o atendimento ambulatorial ocorre mediante encaminhamento pr√©vio vindo da aten√ß√£o prim√°ria ou secund√°ria. O correto √© indicar ao cidad√£o um dos equipamentos de aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, se identificado que trata-se de um problema de sa√∫de de baixa complexidade e n√£o urgente.

### Research Artifact: Reporting Restaurants to Sanitary Surveillance in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To report a restaurant to the sanitary surveillance in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels provided by the municipal government. The primary method for lodging complaints and requests for services is through the Central de Atendimento 1746 [1]. This service can be accessed via telephone by dialing 1746, through a dedicated smartphone application (available for Android and iOS), or via the official portals www.1746.rio and www.carioca.rio [1]. The 1746 platform allows users to register their complaints, including the option to upload photos, and to track the progress of their requests [1].

The Instituto Municipal de Vigil√¢ncia Sanit√°ria, Vigil√¢ncia de Zoonoses e de Inspe√ß√£o Agropecu√°ria (IVISA-Rio), linked to the Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS-Rio), is the body responsible for public health protection through the prevention of risks associated with hygiene and sanitation in activities, services, and products of health interest. The IVISA [1]-Rio also handles the investigation of outbreaks caused by foodborne diseases.

When [1] making a denunciation, it is important to provide comprehensive details to ensure an effective inspection. Essential [2] information includes:
*   The full address of the establishment, including neighborhood, street, and number, along with any reference points.
*   The [1] name of the establishment (fantasy name or legal name).
*   The [1] description of the establishment's activity (e.g., bar, bakery, restaurant, kiosk).
*   A [1] detailed description of the problem encountered, specifying the location of the irregularity within the establishment (e.g., kitchen, dining area).
*   The [1] establishment's days and hours of operation.
*   If [1] applicable, details about products, such as lot numbers, manufacturing and expiry dates, and registration numbers.

The [3] municipal vigilance sanitary services are responsible for handling complaints related to establishments such as supermarkets, bars, restaurants, commercial establishments, beauty salons, and food industries. For issues [1] concerning units like hospitals, clinics with hospitalization, or specific health services, the State Vigil√¢ncia Sanit√°ria may be involved, depending on the nature and location of the establishment.

The process [1] for a denunciation typically involves opening an electronic administrative process, and the complainant may receive a process number to track the progress and conclusion of their report. The expected [4] timeframe for a response or inspection can vary, with some sources indicating up to 15 or 30 days.

For general [1] inquiries, guidance, or issues related to health and sanitary surveillance, the "Rio com Sa√∫de" portal can be a resource, though for matters outside its scope, contacting the State Health Secretariat's ombudsman is advised. The municipal [3] ombudsman's office also serves as a communication channel between citizens and the IVISA-Rio for suggestions and requests, facilitating access to services and mediating conflicts.

The Ag√™ncia [1] Nacional de Vigil√¢ncia Sanit√°ria (Anvisa) is the federal body, and while it sets national guidelines, local denunciation of establishments like restaurants is typically handled by state or municipal vigilance services. Anvisa's role [1] in direct denunciation of establishments is generally for issues that fall under federal jurisdiction or for reporting adverse reactions to products. [1]

**Sources:**

 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/fiscalizacao-de-falta-de-higiene-em-estabelecimentos-de-alimentos-instalacoes-manipulacao-presenca-de-vetores-ou-animais/)

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact: Blood Donation Requirements in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To be eligible to donate blood in Rio de Janeiro, individuals must meet several criteria, as outlined by official health bodies and institutions like the Hemorio (State Blood Center) and the Ministry of Health. These requirements are in place to ensure the safety of both the donor and the recipient.

**General Eligibility Requirements:**

*   **Age:** Donors must be between 16 and 69 years old.
    *   Individuals aged 16 and 17 can donate, but require formal authorization from their legal guardian(s), along with a copy of the guardian's official identification document. A specific authorization form may be required, obtainable from the Hemorio website or donation centers [1].
    *   For individuals between 60 and 69 years old, they can only donate if they have made a previous donation before reaching the age of 60 [1]. The upper age limit for a first-time donation is generally 60 years old [2].
*   **Weight:** Donors must weigh at least 50 kg [1].
*   **Health Status:** Donors must be in good health and feel well at the time of donation [1]. They should not be experiencing symptoms of a cold, flu, or allergic reactions [1].
*   **Rest and Nutrition:** It is important to be well-rested before donating, having slept for at least 6 hours in the preceding 24 hours [1]. Donors should also be well-fed, avoiding fatty foods for four hours prior to donation and alcoholic beverages for 12 hours beforehand [1]. Donating on an empty stomach is not recommended [1].
*   **Identification:** Donors must present an official identification document with a photo, which can be an identity card, driver's license, work card, or passport [1].

**Intervals Between Donations:**

*   Men can donate blood every two months, with a maximum of four donations per year [1].
*   Women can donate every three months, with a maximum of three donations per year [1]. This difference is attributed to the longer recovery time for iron stores in women due to menstrual cycles [1].

**Specific Conditions and Temporary Impediments:**

*   **Pregnancy and Breastfeeding:** Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding are not eligible to donate [1].
*   **Tattoos and Piercings:** Individuals who have received tattoos or undergone acupuncture must wait six months from the date of the procedure before donating. For piercings, especially in oral or genital areas, a one-year waiting period after removal is required if the sanitary conditions of the piercing cannot be fully assessed [2].
*   **Recent Illnesses:**
    *   Those who have had COVID-19 must wait 10 days after recovery [2].
    *   Individuals who have had classic dengue fever must wait one month after recovery. If they had hemorrhagic dengue, the waiting period is six months [2].
    *   There are also specific waiting periods after vaccinations, such as 48 hours after an influenza vaccine [1].
*   **Medications:** The use of certain medications may lead to temporary deferral, and these are evaluated individually during the pre-donation screening [1].
*   **Other Conditions:** Certain chronic conditions such as diabetes, AIDS, Hepatitis, Syphilis, Chagas disease, Malaria, Cancer, and Hyperthyroidism can be grounds for permanent or temporary exclusion, as determined during the clinical interview [1].

**Donation Process and Safety:**

The blood donation process itself is considered safe, as sterile, disposable materials are used for each donor, and a clinical screening is conducted prior to donation to assess the donor's health [1]. After donation, donors are advised to rest for a short period, consume a snack, and avoid strenuous physical activity, smoking, and alcohol for a specified time [1].

**Where to Donate:**

The Hemorio (Rua Frei Caneca, 8 ‚Äì Centro, Rio de Janeiro) is a primary donation center, operating daily from 7 AM to 6 PM, including weekends and holidays. Other [1] public blood collection points coordinated by Hemorio exist throughout the state of Rio de Janeiro. Additionally [1], various hospitals and blood banks, such as Banco de Sangue Serum (Centro and Barra units) and Hemocentro S√£o Lucas (Barra da Tijuca), also facilitate blood donations. [2]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [cremerj.org.br](https://www.cremerj.org.br/downloads/pdf/orientacoes_para_doacao_sangue.pdf;jsessionid=9706363A843B8C6F0B42F8910B9CD275?inline=inline)
 - [2] [ufrj.br](https://www.hucff.ufrj.br/doe-sangue/)

To schedule a cardiology appointment through SUS in Rio de Janeiro, the general process involves seeking an initial referral from a primary care unit. The Super Centro Carioca de Sa√∫de, which offers specialized services including cardiology, receives patients exclusively through the Sisreg (Sistema de Regula√ß√£o) system, with appointments scheduled based on availability and clinical priority. Patients [1] are not able to directly schedule appointments at the Super Centro Carioca de Sa√∫de; instead, referrals are made by healthcare teams at family clinics and municipal health centers.

- Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. A consulta pode ser feita neste link: https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser
- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To file a complaint regarding a family clinic in Rio de Janeiro, the primary channel for citizen services is the **Central de Atendimento 1746** [1]. This service acts as the first point of contact for citizens with the municipality and handles various types of manifestations, including complaints, suggestions, criticisms, and praise [2].

**How to Contact 1746:**
*   **By Phone:** Dial 1746 within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro. For calls from other locations, use (21) 3460-1746 [2].
*   **Online Portal:** Access the official portal at www.1746.rio [1]. The portal is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, including holidays [2].

**Ouvidoria (Ombudsman):**
The Ouvidoria serves as a second instance for citizen-municipal relations. It is designed to receive complaints regarding requests made to the Prefecture that were not fulfilled within the expected timeframe or with the desired quality [1]. It is generally recommended to first contact the Central de Atendimento 1746 before escalating to the Ouvidoria [1]. The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) has its own Ouvidoria that specifically addresses issues related to health services [1].

**Nature of a Complaint:**
A complaint is defined as an expression of dissatisfaction related to a request already made to a public entity, concerning the response or service provided (e.g., regarding deadline, content, or quality) [2]. For complaints submitted through the 1746 system, it is often necessary to provide a previous protocol number associated with the initial request [2].

**Information Required:**
When registering a complaint, individuals may be asked to provide personal details such as their full name, CEP (postal code), phone number, and email address [2]. Providing sufficient information about the service and health professionals involved is also encouraged for effective processing [3].

It is important to note that the Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) is responsible for the city's health services, while the State Health Secretariat (SES RJ) and Funda√ß√£o Sa√∫de manage state-level health services. For [1] issues concerning municipal family clinics, the 1746 channels are the appropriate avenues for lodging complaints. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [prefeitura.rio](https://saude.prefeitura.rio/ouvidoria/)
 - [2] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/p/ouvidoria)
 - [3] [saude.rj.gov.br](https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/ouvidoria/como-registrar-manifestacoes-em-ouvidorias-do-sus-pela-internet)

**Topic:** How to complain about slow emergency hospital service in Rio de Janeiro.

To register a complaint regarding slow emergency hospital service in Rio de Janeiro, citizens have several official channels available, primarily through the municipal and state health secretariats and their respective ombudsman offices (Ouvidoria).

**Municipal Health Secretariat (Secretaria Municipal de Sa√∫de - SMS) of Rio de Janeiro:**
The primary channel for complaints, suggestions, and praise related to services provided in municipal health units is the **Central de Atendimento 1746**. [1] This service operates 24 hours a day, seven days a week, including holidays. Citizens can contact 1746 by phone or through the portal www.1746.rio.gov.br. This can be done by phone through a dedicated sector within the Central 1746, via the website www.rio.rj.gov.br (linking to the Ouvidoria), or in person at the various Ouvidoria locations for each health region (CAPs) within the municipality. [1] The municipal Ouvidoria's central office is located at Rua Afonso Cavalcanti, n¬∫ 455 / 8¬∫ andar / sala 825 ‚Äì Cidade Nova, Rio de Janeiro/RJ, with operating hours on weekdays from 9 am to 5 pm.

**State [1] Health Secretariat (Secretaria de Estado de Sa√∫de - SES) of Rio de Janeiro:**
For services provided by units managed by the State Health Foundation (Funda√ß√£o Sa√∫de), the **Ouvidoria Geral da Funda√ß√£o Sa√∫de** is the designated channel. Complaints [1], criticisms, suggestions, or praise regarding assistance in state-managed health units can be submitted via email to ouvidoria@fundacaosaude.rj.gov.br, by phone at (21) 3293-3300 Ramal 1304, or by mail to Rua Bar√£o de Itapagipe, 225, Rio Comprido ‚Äì Rio de Janeiro ‚Äì RJ ‚Äì CEP: 20261-005. Additionally, the [1] State Health Secretariat itself offers a tele-service for complaints and inquiries at 0800 025 55 25.

**General SUS Ombudsman [1] (Ouvidoria-Geral do SUS):**
For broader issues concerning the Unified Health System (SUS), the Ouvidoria-Geral do SUS (OuvSUS) can be accessed through the Ministry of Health's portal. This channel allows [2] users to register complaints, requests, suggestions, and denouncements. - Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. ## Research Artifact: Scheduling Mammograms via SUS in Rio de Janeiro for Women Aged 40+

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To schedule a mammogram through the Unified Health System (SUS) in Rio de Janeiro, women aged 40 and over should follow a process that typically involves obtaining a medical request and then proceeding to their local health unit for scheduling. While the Ministry of Health's guidelines for routine screening mammography recommend the exam every two years for women between 50 and 69 years old, there are provisions and ongoing efforts to expand access for women aged 40 and above [1].

### General Procedure for Scheduling

The process for scheduling a mammogram differs slightly depending on whether the resident is in the capital city of Rio de Janeiro or in other municipalities within the state:

*   **In the Capital (Rio de Janeiro City):** Residents should first visit a "cl√≠nica da fam√≠lia" (family clinic) or a basic health unit in their neighborhood. At this unit, they will need to present a medical request (pedido m√©dico) issued by a public health unit, along with their identification documents, SUS card (Cart√£o SUS), and proof of residence. These [2] local units have access to the "Rio Imagem" system, which is the state's diagnostic imaging center, and also utilize the SISREG system for scheduling appointments. The [2] municipal health secretariat (SMS) manages these schedules, with reported average waiting times of approximately 34 days for routine screening and 25 days for diagnostic investigations. The [1] Centro Carioca de Diagn√≥stico e Tratamento por Imagem (CCDTI) is a significant facility within the municipal network that performs these exams.

*  [1]  **In Other Municipalities of Rio de Janeiro State:** Patients residing outside the capital must first go to their respective Municipal Health Secretariat. They need to bring a medical request from a public health unit and their identification documents. The Municipal Health Secretariats are responsible for scheduling the mammograms through the "Rio Imagem" system on behalf of the patients.

## [2]# Access for Women Aged 40 and Over

While the official recommendation for *screening* mammography targets women aged 50-69, women aged 40 and over can access the exam through SUS, particularly if there is a clinical indication or through specific health campaigns.

*  [1]  **Clinical Indication:** If a woman experiences symptoms such as a lump in the breast or armpit, swelling, nipple changes, or skin alterations, she should seek evaluation at her primary care unit. The doctor can then issue a request for a mammogram or other necessary diagnostic tests.
*   [1] **Special Campaigns and Initiatives:** Various campaigns, often held during "Outubro Rosa" (Pink October), may offer mammograms to women aged 40 and over. For instance, the CREMERJ (Regional Council of Medicine of Rio de Janeiro) has held events where women over 40 could schedule mammograms, though these often require prior registration and can fill up quickly. Mobile [3] mammography units also conduct outreach, sometimes requiring only a medical request for participation. For [4] breast ultrasonography, women over 40 may be required to present their most recent mammogram report.
*   [3] **Legislative Efforts:** There is ongoing legislative effort, such as Projeto de Decreto Legislativo n¬∫ 679/2019, aiming to ensure that mammograms are available for all Brazilian women starting at age 40.

### [5] Required Documentation

To schedule and undergo a mammogram, patients generally need to present the following:
*   Medical request or prescription (Pedido M√©dico Original).
*   Identification [2] document (e.g., RG - Carteira de Identidade).
*   SUS [2] Card (Cart√£o SUS).
*   Proof [2] of residence (Comprovante de resid√™ncia).
*   For [2] specific exams like breast ultrasonography for women over 40, the report from the last mammogram is also required.

### Key [3] Facilities and Systems

*   **Rio Imagem:** The state's diagnostic imaging program, which serves SUS users across Rio de Janeiro.
*   **SISREG [2]:** The state's regulation system used by municipal health secretariats to manage appointment scheduling.
*   **Cl√≠nicas [1] da Fam√≠lia / Unidades B√°sicas de Sa√∫de:** Primary points of access for residents in the capital city.
*   **Municipal [2] Health Secretariats:** The primary points of access for residents in municipalities outside the capital.
*   **Centro [2] Carioca de Diagn√≥stico e Tratamento por Imagem (CCDTI):** A key facility within the municipal health network in Rio de Janeiro city. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [prefeitura.rio](https://prefeitura.rio/saude/mais-mulheres-chegam-ao-sus-no-rio-para-o-exame-de-mamografia/)
 - [2] [saude.rj.gov.br](https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/atendimento/exames)
 - [3] [cremerj.org.br](https://www.cremerj.org.br/informes/exibe/6185)
 - [4] [cremerj.org.br](https://www.cremerj.org.br/servicocidadao/agendamento/mamografia)

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to request a health agent visit for a dengue outbreak in Rio de Janeiro.

To request a health agent visit for a dengue outbreak in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize the Central de Atendimento da Prefeitura, known as 1746 [1]. This service can be accessed via telephone, the 1746 Rio app, or through the 1746.rio website [2]. The Teledengue service, operational since 2003, also allows residents to request agent visits or report situations conducive to mosquito breeding [3]. Teledengue can be contacted by phone at 2575-0007, Monday to Friday, from 8 AM to 8 PM [3].

The Portal Rio 1746 offers a specific service for "Vistoria em foco de Aedes Aegypti (Dengue, Chikungunya e Zika)" [1]. To request this service, individuals need to provide their full name, CEP (postal code), and mobile number [1]. The expected timeframe for service delivery is up to 5 business days [1].

The Municipal Health Secretariat (SMS) also conducts street-level actions for dengue prevention and control [1]. In cases where a citizen cannot eliminate a potential mosquito breeding ground, they can report it through the 1746 channels [2]. The 1746 service aims to respond to over 95% of requests within five business days [3].

For immediate medical attention regarding dengue symptoms, such as high fever, body aches, and rash, residents are advised to seek care at one of the 238 primary care units (family clinics and municipal health centers) or at the ten Dengue Attention Centers across the city [1]. In emergencies, individuals should go to a UPA (24-Hour Emergency Unit) or a CER (Regional Emergency Center) [1].

The city of Rio de Janeiro actively engages in combating dengue through various initiatives, including educational actions, public mobilization, and the expansion of the Wolbachia method, which involves releasing mosquitoes infected with the Wolbachia bacteria to reduce the transmission of arboviruses [1]. The municipality emphasizes that combating dengue requires a collective effort, with each citizen playing a role in preventing mosquito proliferation [1].

**Sources:**
 - [1] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10221081525787-Vistoria-em-foco-de-Aedes-Aegypti-Dengue-Chikungunya-e-Zika)
 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/vistoria-em-foco-de-aedes-aegypti-dengue-chikungunya-e-zika/)
 - [3] [rio.rj.gov.br](http://www0.rio.rj.gov.br/pcrj/destaques/servicos/destaque_teledengue.htm)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to request more policing on the streets of Rio de Janeiro.

To request additional policing in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels. The primary method for non-emergency requests and general citizen services is the **Portal 1746** [1]. This portal allows users to submit various requests, including those related to public safety, by navigating through service categories or using a keyword search [1]. The 1746 service is also accessible via phone, with the number 1746 for calls within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro and (21) 3460-1746 for other locations [2]. An application for the 1746 service is also available, connecting citizens to municipal services [3].

For emergency situations, the public should contact **190**, which is the emergency number for the Military Police of Rio de Janeiro (PMERJ) [1]. The PMERJ also offers an application called **190RJ** for citizens to request assistance [1].

[2] This can be done through their electronic system (Ouverj), by phone at (21) 2334-6045, or via email at ouvidoria_controladoria@pmerj.rj.gov.br. Their physical address is Rua Carmo Neto, s/n¬∫, Cidade Nova, Rio de Janeiro/RJ, 1¬∫ Andar ‚Äì CICC, with operating hours from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday.

Additionally [3], specific programs like "Bairro Presente" are mentioned as special policing initiatives by the State Military Police for crime prevention and combat. While [2] not a direct request channel for increased policing in a specific street, these programs represent broader efforts in public safety.

It is also noted that community-level initiatives, such as petitions for increased policing in specific streets, are undertaken by residents to address local security concerns. [4]

- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

Sendo de m√©dia complexidade, direcionar para rede de aten√ß√£o secund√°ria uma UPA ou CER. Se for identificado como alta complexidade, direcionar para a rede de aten√ß√£o terci√°ria (hospitais). ### 6.2) Orienta√ß√µes ap√≥s o parto (m√£es ou pais em per√≠odo p√≥s-parto e que rec√©m tiveram filho):

√â crucial lembrar que, ap√≥s a alta da maternidade, seu beb√™ deve ter uma primeira consulta de rotina com o pediatra ou enfermeiro da Cl√≠nica da Fam√≠lia ou Centro Municipal de Sa√∫de nos primeiros 3 a 7 dias de vida. # Regras para classifica√ß√£o de complexidade

## Atendimentos de m√©dia complexidade: representam risco √† sa√∫de, mas sem risco iminente de morte.

## Atendimentos de alta complexidade: condi√ß√µes graves, que indicam a necessidade de procedimentos cir√∫rgicos de urg√™ncia ou de alta complexidade, ou condi√ß√µes que representam risco iminente de morte.

### Research Artifact: Soliciting Increased Police Patrols in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To request increased police patrols in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels, primarily involving the Military Police of the State of Rio de Janeiro (PMERJ) and the municipal service portal 1746.

For emergency situations, the primary contact number for the Military Police is **190** [1]. This line operates 24 hours a day for emergency assistance.

For non-emergency requests, suggestions, complaints, or to provide feedback on services, the Ouvidoria (Ombudsman) of the State Military Police is available. The Ouvidoria Geral da Secretaria de Estado de Pol√≠cia Militar can be contacted via their electronic system (Ouverj), by phone at (21) 2334-6045, or by email at ouvidoria_controladoria@pmerj.rj.gov.br. Their physical address is Rua Carmo Neto, s/n¬∫, 1¬∫ Andar ‚Äì CICC, Cidade Nova, Rio de Janeiro/RJ, with operating hours from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday. The [1] PMERJ also has an application called "190RJ" which allows citizens to request assistance from the Military Police.

The [1] municipal service portal, **1746.rio**, and its associated platforms (website, WhatsApp at 3460-1746, phone number 1746, and app) are also channels for requesting various municipal services, which may include public safety matters. The [1] portal allows citizens to submit requests, track their progress, and access information on a wide range of services provided by the Rio de Janeiro City Hall.

The [2] State Military Police (PMERJ) also engages in community policing initiatives and has specific programs such as "Patrulha Escolar" (School Patrol) and "Bairro Presente" (Present Neighborhood) aimed at increasing police presence and preventing crime in specific areas. While [2] these programs are specific initiatives, general requests for increased patrol can be directed through the aforementioned channels.

For reporting non-emergency crimes or seeking information, the Civil Police can be contacted via their general number 197, or through their online services such as the "Delegacia Online" for pre-registration of occurrences. The [2] Civil Police also has an Ombudsman (Ouvidoria-Geral de Pol√≠cia Civil) for citizen feedback and requests.

The [3] "Seguran√ßa Presente" program is another initiative that aims to increase police presence in specific areas, with bases and operational activities reported across the city.

In summary [4], for immediate emergencies, dial 190. For non-emergency requests or to provide feedback, utilize the PMERJ's Ouvidoria or the 1746 portal.

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** Den√∫ncia de viol√™ncia dom√©stica no Rio de Janeiro

**Summary of Findings:**

In Rio de Janeiro, several channels are available for reporting domestic violence and seeking assistance. Victims and concerned citizens can utilize a network of services provided by both state and municipal authorities.

**Key Reporting Channels and Services:**

*   **Ligue 180:** This is the Central de Atendimento √† Mulher (Women's Service Center) and operates 24 hours a day, offering qualified listening and support to women experiencing violence. It also registers and forwards complaints to the appropriate bodies.
*  [1]  **Ligue 190:** For emergencies, this number connects to the Military Police and is available 24 hours a day. A police unit is dispatched immediately to the location.
*  [1]  **Ligue 197:** This number is for the Civil Police and can be used to report domestic violence. It operates on weekdays from 9 AM to 5 PM. Victims can register occurrences at a police station, preferably at a Delegacia Especializada de Atendimento √† Mulher (DEAM ‚Äì Specialized Women's Service Station), or through the 197 service. This service can also assist with requests for protective measures.
*   * [1]*Central 1746:** This service, operated by the Prefeitura do Rio (Rio de Janeiro City Hall), receives notifications of harassment and aggression. It can be contacted via phone or through its website.
*   * [1]*Delegacia Online (Online Police Station):** Women aged 18 and over who are victims of domestic violence, including crimes like bodily harm, threats, insult, calumny, and defamation, can file an online occurrence report. However, urgent protective measures cannot be requested online.

**Specialized [2] Support Centers:**

*   **Delegacias Especializadas no Atendimento √† Mulher (DEAMs):** These are specialized police stations dedicated to attending to women victims of violence.
*   **Centro [1] Especializado de Atendimento √† Mulher (CEAM):** The Secretaria de Pol√≠ticas e Promo√ß√£o da Mulher (Secretariat of Policies and Promotion of Women) in Rio de Janeiro offers specialized support through CEAMs. These centers provide psychosocial and legal assistance to women in situations of violence, even if they do not wish to file a report immediately. Examples include CEAM Chiquinha Gonzaga (Rua Benedito Hip√≥lito 125, Centro) and CEAM Tia Ga√∫cha (Policl√≠nica Lincoln de Freitas Filho, Rua √Ålvaro Alberto, 601 - Santa Cruz).
*   **Casa da Mulher [1] Brasileira:** Rio de Janeiro is establishing its first Casa da Mulher Brasileira, a comprehensive facility that will integrate specialized services such as psychosocial, legal, and police support, including DEAM, a Reference Center, a Shelter House, Public Defender's Office, Domestic Violence Court, Prosecutor's Office, and social/medical assistance.
*   **Casa Viva [3] Mulher Cora Coralina (Casa Abrigo):** This is a confidential shelter house for women victims of domestic violence in imminent danger, along with their children.

**Legal Framework [4]:**

The reporting and support systems are largely guided by the Lei Maria da Penha (Law No. 11.340/2006), which aims to combat and prevent domestic violence against women.

**Additional Information [2]:**

*   The Minist√©rio P√∫blico do Estado (MPRJ) also offers channels for reporting and can be contacted via their Ouvidoria (Ombudsman's Office) by calling 127 during weekdays from 9 AM to 6 PM.
*   The "Rede Mulher [4]" application, developed by the Military Police of Rio de Janeiro, provides an emergency button for contacting 190 and facilitates online occurrence reporting through the Civil Police website.
*   In 2025, Rio [2] de Janeiro was noted as the state with the second-highest number of domestic violence reports in Brazil, with over 13,000 reports from January to July. [1]

The PCERJ website offers a direct link to obtain this document. It is [2] also mentioned that the Pol√≠cia Civil certificate can be issued online through a federal system.

Users will [1] need to fill out a form with their personal details. To find the digital work card number, individuals can utilize the "Carteira de Trabalho Digital" application, available for both Android and iOS devices. [1] Access to the application is granted by logging in with the user's Gov.br account credentials (CPF and password). For those who may need to reference the older physical work card number and series, it can be found within the physical document itself, typically located below the photo and personal details. [1] However, the digital format is the current standard, and the CPF serves as the primary identifier for the digital work card. [2] The digital work card application also provides access to other labor-related information and benefits, such as employment contracts, vacation records, and social security contributions. [4]

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date:** August 9, 2025

**Topic:** How to withdraw FGTS upon dismissal

**Summary:**

Workers in Brazil who are dismissed without just cause are entitled to withdraw their FGTS (Fundo de Garantia por Tempo de Servi√ßo) balance. [1] The FGTS serves as a financial reserve for workers under the CLT (Consolida√ß√£o das Leis de Trabalho) regime, providing support in situations such as dismissal without just cause, retirement, or the end of a fixed-term contract.

 [1]**Process for Withdrawing FGTS:**

The withdrawal process can be completed digitally through the FGTS mobile application or in person at a Caixa Econ√¥mica Federal agency.

1 [1].  **Digital Withdrawal via FGTS App:**
    *   Download and register on the FGTS app, available for Android and iOS.
   [2]  *   On the app's home screen, select "Meus Saques" (My Withdrawals).
   [2]  *   Choose the "Saque-Rescis√£o" (Withdrawal-Dismissal) option and follow the on-screen instructions.
    [2] *   Indicate a bank account (either Caixa or another financial institution) for the funds to be deposited into. This service is free of charge.
    [1] *   Upload the necessary documents through the app.
    [1] *   The funds are typically deposited into the designated account within 5 business days after the request is approved.

2. [1]  **In-Person Withdrawal at Caixa Econ√¥mica Federal:**
    *   If the employer does not formally communicate the dismissal through the e-Social or Conectividade Social systems, or if the worker prefers an in-person process, they must visit a Caixa Econ√¥mica Federal agency.
    * [3]   Bring all required documentation to the agency.
    * [3]   In some cases, withdrawals can also be made at Caixa lottery outlets for amounts up to R$ 3,000.00, provided the documentation is correct and the funds are available.

**Required [1] Documentation:**

The standard documentation required for FGTS withdrawal upon dismissal includes:
*   A valid official identification document with a photo (e.g., RG, CNH).
*   The [1] worker's CPF or PIS/PASEP/NIS number.
*   The [1] Carteira de Trabalho e Previd√™ncia Social (CTPS). For dismissals [1] formalized after November 11, 2017, the CTPS is essential. For earlier dismissals, the Termo de Rescis√£o do Contrato de Trabalho (TRCT) or Termo de Homologa√ß√£o da Rescis√£o do Contrato de Trabalho (THRCT) may be required if the employer did not communicate the dismissal.
*   Additional [2] documents may be necessary in specific situations, such as terms of conciliation from the Labor Justice, court rulings, or other official documents proving the dismissal without just cause.

**Important [2] Considerations:**

*   **Dismissal Type:** The right to withdraw the full FGTS balance, including the 40% termination fine, is generally applicable only in cases of dismissal *without just cause*. If a worker [2] resigns (pede demiss√£o) or is dismissed for just cause, they are typically not entitled to withdraw the FGTS balance, although they may be eligible for the Saque-Anivers√°rio (Birthday Withdrawal) or other specific withdrawal conditions.
*   **Deadline [4] for Withdrawal:** While the employer has up to 10 business days to report the termination to Caixa, the worker generally has up to 30 days to request the withdrawal after the dismissal is communicated. If this deadline [2] is missed, a new withdrawal key may need to be requested, potentially delaying the process.
*   **Saque-Anivers√°rio [5] vs. Saque-Rescis√£o:** The FGTS has two main withdrawal modalities: Saque-Rescis√£o (standard for dismissal) and Saque-Anivers√°rio (allowing annual partial withdrawals). Opting for Saque-Anivers√°rio means forfeiting the right to withdraw the full balance upon dismissal, only retaining the 40% termination fine. [2]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [www.gov.br](https://www.gov.br/pt-br/servicos/sacar-o-fgts)
 - [2] [exame.com](https://exame.com/brasil/guia-do-cidadao/como-sacar-meu-fgts-pelo-saque-rescisao-veja-as-regras/)
 - [3] [bancobmg.com.br](https://www.bancobmg.com.br/blog/educacao-financeira/saque-rescisao-do-fgts-o-que-e-e-como-solicitar/)
 - [4] [santander.com.br](https://www.santander.com.br/blog/saque-rescisao-fgts)
 - [5] [bancobmg.com.br](https://www.bancobmg.com.br/blog/educacao-financeira/como-sacar-fgts-retido/)

**Methods for Consulting FGTS Balance via Mobile:**

**Research Artifact: PIS 2024 Eligibility and Payment Calendar**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To determine eligibility for the PIS (Programa de Integra√ß√£o Social) 2024 and understand its payment calendar, workers must meet specific criteria and can utilize various official channels for consultation. The PIS is an annual benefit designed to integrate workers into social development and provides an abono salarial (wage bonus) to eligible individuals.
 [1]
**Eligibility Requirements for PIS 2024:**

To be eligible for the PIS 2024 abono salarial, workers must simultaneously meet the following conditions, based on the year-base 2022:
 [2]
*   **Registration:** Be registered in the PIS/PASEP program for at least five years, counting from the date of the first employment with a contributing employer.
 [2]*   **Remuneration:** Have received an average monthly remuneration of up to two minimum wages during the year-base. For [2] 2024, the minimum wage considered is R$1,412.00, meaning the average monthly income should not exceed R$2,824.00.
 [3]*   **Work Period:** Have worked for at least 30 days, consecutively or not, in the year-base.
 [2]*   **Data Submission:** Have their information correctly reported by the employer to the government through the Rela√ß√£o Anual de Informa√ß√µes Sociais (RAIS) or the eSocial system within the established deadlines. For the [2] year-base 2022, RAIS data should have been submitted by May 15, 2024, and eSocial data by August 19, 2024. If data [4] is submitted after these dates, the benefit may be paid in the following year.

**PIS [4] Payment Calendar for 2024:**

The payment of the PIS 2024 abono salarial, referring to the year-base 2022, began on February 15, 2024, and extends until August 15, 2024. The distribution [2] is organized according to the beneficiary's month of birth. The final [2] deadline for withdrawing the benefit is December 27, 2024.

The [1] specific payment schedule based on the month of birth is as follows:

*   [1] **January:** Payments start from February 15, 2024.
*   **February:** Payments start from March 15, 2024.
*   **March:** Payments start from April 15, 2024.
*   **April:** Payments start from April 15, 2024.
*   **May:** Payments start from May 15, 2024.
*   **June:** Payments start from May 15, 2024.
*   **July:** Payments start from June 17, 2024.
*   **August:** Payments start from June 17, 2024.
*   **September:** Payments start from July 15, 2024.
*   **October:** Payments start from July 15, 2024.
*   **November:** Payments start from August 15, 2024.
*   **December:** Payments start from August 15, 2024.

**How to Consult PIS Information:**

Workers can check their PIS eligibility and payment details through several official channels:

*   **Caixa Econ√¥mica Federal:**
    *   **Telephone:** Call the Caixa Customer Service at 0800 726 0207. This line is available 24 hours a day for inquiries related to PIS, Social Benefits, FGTS, and the Social Card.
    * [3]   **Apps:** The Caixa Tem app, Caixa Trabalhador app, and the Caixa Social Benefits app can be used for consultations.
    * [2]   **Website:** The Portal Cidad√£o (cidadao.caixa.gov.br) is another channel for information.
*   **Government [2] Portals:**
    *   **Carteira de Trabalho Digital (Digital Work Card):** Available as an app or website, this platform provides access to employment information, including the PIS number.
    *  [3]  **Portal Gov.br:** This portal also offers access to PIS information.
    *  [2]  **Meu INSS:** The Meu INSS website and app, integrated with gov.br, allow users to check their PIS number and contribution history via the CNIS (Cadastro Nacional de Informa√ß√µes Sociais).
*   **Central [3] Al√¥ Trabalho:** Workers can call 158 for information regarding the PIS benefit.

The PIS benefit [3] is managed by Caixa Econ√¥mica Federal for private sector workers, while the PASEP (Programa de Forma√ß√£o do Patrim√¥nio do Servidor P√∫blico) is managed by Banco do Brasil for public sector employees. The value of the [1] abono salarial is proportional to the number of months worked in the year-base, with the maximum amount equivalent to one minimum wage. [3]

**Research Artifact: Como Dar Entrada no Seguro-Desemprego pela Internet**

The process for applying for unemployment benefits ("seguro-desemprego") online in Brazil is primarily managed through federal government digital platforms. The main channels available for initiating the application are the "Carteira de Trabalho Digital" mobile application and the "Emprega Brasil" website [1].

**Online Application Process:**

1.  **Access the Platform:** Download the "Carteira de Trabalho Digital" app on your smartphone (available for Android and iOS) or access the "Emprega Brasil" portal via the internet [1].
2.  **Login:** You will need to log in using your "Gov.br" account. If you do not have one, you will need to create it [1].
3.  **Initiate Application:** Within the app or portal, navigate to the "Benef√≠cios" (Benefits) section and select "Seguro-Desemprego". [1] Then, choose the option to "Solicitar" (Apply). [1]
4.  **Enter Requerimento Number:** You will be prompted to enter the "Requerimento do Seguro-Desemprego" number. This is a 10-digit code provided by your former employer on the "Requerimento do Seguro-Desemprego e Comunica√ß√£o de Dispensa" form, typically given at the time of dismissal.
5 [1].  **Confirm Information:** Review and confirm your personal data, employment history, and banking information for the benefit deposit. It [1] is crucial to provide accurate bank details, as the benefit will be credited to the account specified.
6 [2].  **Submit:** Follow the on-screen instructions to complete and submit your application.

 [1]**Required Documentation:**

*   CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas F√≠sicas)

**Timeframe [4] for Application:**

The application for Seguro-Desemprego must be made within specific deadlines after dismissal:
*   For formal workers: between the 7th and 120th day after dismissal.

**Rio [2] de Janeiro Specific Information:**

**Monitoring [4] the Application:**

# Instru√ß√µes fundamentais

- Caso o cidad√£o queira consultar o status de um agendamento no SISREG, orientar que acesse a √°rea logada do portal ou aplicativo MinhaSaude.rio, e acesse o menu "SISREG". procedimentos mais complexos s√£o feitos pela rede de sa√∫de estadual e precisam ser consultados no sistema SER. A consulta pode ser feita neste link: https://www.saude.rj.gov.br/transparencia/acesso-a-informacao/2019/07/14-lista-de-espera-regulacao-ser
- Caso o cidad√£o esteja enfrentando problemas t√©cnicos e necessite de suporte o aplicativo/portal Minha Sa√∫de orientar que entre em contato com o Whatsapp do Minha Sa√∫de no n√∫mero (21) 97723-8972 ou atrav√©s do e-mail: minhasaude.rio@regulacaoriorj.com.br
- N√£o mandar respostas muito longas e evitar citar termos muito t√©cnicos. Tamb√©m evitar trazer detalhes sobre as regras de neg√≥cio que voc√™ utilizar√° para definir o melhor equipamento. Al√©m disso, evitar mencionar os termos aten√ß√£o prim√°ria, secund√°ria ou terci√°ria.

# N√≠veis de aten√ß√£o da sa√∫de e seus equipamentos

- Centros Municipais de Sa√∫de (CMS): Unidades que podem cobrir parte ou todo o territ√≥rio com equipes de Sa√∫de da Fam√≠lia, tamb√©m atuando na aten√ß√£o b√°sica, com consultas, vacina√ß√£o, pr√©-natal e outros servi√ßos.

Verificar o item ‚ÄúRegras para classifica√ß√£o de complexidade‚Äù para apoiar no processo de defini√ß√£o.
Sendo de m√©dia complexidade, direcionar para rede de aten√ß√£o secund√°ria uma UPA ou CER. Se for identificado como alta complexidade, direcionar para a rede de aten√ß√£o terci√°ria (hospitais). ## 4) Atendimentos em sa√∫de mental

Se n√£o, enviar√≠amos uma outra pergunta: "√â caso de emerg√™ncia com risco de vida? Exemplos: crise psiqui√°trica com risco iminente de vida para o paciente ou para terceiros (Exemplo: risco de suic√≠dio com intoxica√ß√£o por medica√ß√£o ou outro dano f√≠sico ou crise de abstin√™ncia de √°lcool ou outras drogas.) Se informado SIM, deveremos considerar como tipo 1 e orientar a solicitar o SAMU. Caso informado N√ÉO, perguntar se √© poss√≠vel chegar at√© o local por meios pr√≥prios. ## 5) Vacina√ß√£o

### 6.2) Orienta√ß√µes ap√≥s o parto (m√£es ou pais em per√≠odo p√≥s-parto e que rec√©m tiveram filho):

A orienta√ß√£o √© que o cidad√£o chegue para a consulta ou exame na unidade agendada com pelo menos 15 minutos de anteced√™ncia do hor√°rio marcado, levando os seguintes documentos:

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact: Rio de Janeiro Municipal Microcredit Programs for Autonomous Workers**

As of August 9, 2025, the Rio de Janeiro municipal government has been involved in initiatives to provide microcredit to entrepreneurs, including autonomous and informal workers, to foster economic activity and improve quality of life.

One notable program was **Crediamigo**, established in 2009 through a partnership between the Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro and the Banco do Nordeste. This program was designed to finance groups within the solidarity economy, enabling them to secure resources for expanding their small businesses. Crediamigo aimed to reach approximately 40,000 formal and informal micro and small entrepreneurs in Rio de Janeiro. The loans offered ranged from R$ 100 to R$ 10,000, with interest rates varying between 1.32% and 3%. Initially, the service was available in five low-income communities: Rocinha, Rio das Pedras, Inhoa√≠ba, Mar√©, and Gl√≥ria, with plans for expansion throughout the municipality.

In [1] 2018, the Mayor of Rio de Janeiro launched the **Rio Empreendedor** program. This initiative was coordinated by the Municipal Secretariat of Development, Employment, and Innovation (SMDEI) and aimed to provide microcredit to stimulate economic activities within the city. The program's objective was to enhance the quality of life for lower-income individuals facing social vulnerability. The initial implementation of Rio Empreendedor focused on the Vila Kennedy community, specifically supporting small merchants by offering a microcredit line for the acquisition and installation of work equipment and furnishings.

Additionally [2], the **Ag√™ncia de Fomento do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (AgeRio)**, a state-level entity, offers microcredit to microentrepreneurs, including autonomous workers. AgeRio's microcredit program provides financing from R$ 300 up to R$ 21,000, with a monthly interest rate of 0.25% and repayment terms extending up to 24 months. AgeRio emphasizes that credit analysis and application processes are free of charge and do not involve any advance payments. The agency also clarifies that the microcredit funds must be invested directly into the client's business and cannot be used to settle existing debts.

The [1] broader context suggests that municipalities can develop microcredit alternatives for entrepreneurs who may not have access to the traditional financial system. The [1] Municipal Secretariat of Urban and Economic Development (SMDUE) plays a role in simplifying bureaucratic processes and improving the business environment within Rio de Janeiro. [3]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [resende.rj.gov.br](https://resende.rj.gov.br/noticias/prefeitura-e-caixa-econ-mica-lan-am-programa-para-microcr-dito)
 - [2] [www.rj.gov.br](https://www.rj.gov.br/casacivil/node/113)
 - [3] [agerio.com.br](https://www.agerio.com.br/)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** Vagas de emprego prefeitura rio de janeiro site oficial

Official channels for finding job openings with the Rio de Janeiro City Hall (Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro) include the Municipal Secretariat of Labor and Income (Secretaria Municipal de Trabalho e Renda - SMTE) and the general official portal for the city.

The primary website for job opportunities managed by the SMTE is **trabalho.prefeitura.rio** [1]. This portal provides information on available jobs and related programs. **Research Artifact: Cart√£o Idoso Estacionamento Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

The "Cart√£o de Estacionamento para Idoso" (Elderly Parking Card) in Rio de Janeiro is a document that grants individuals aged 60 years or older the right to use designated parking spaces. This card is valid nationwide and is issued by the municipal government of Rio de Janeiro.
 [1]
**Eligibility and Validity:**
To be eligible for the card, individuals must be 60 years of age or older. The [1] card has a validity period of five years, after which a new card must be requested.
 [1]
**How to Obtain the Card:**
The application process for the "Cart√£o de Estacionamento para Idoso" can be completed through two primary methods:

1.  **Online via Carioca Digital:**
    *   Access the Carioca Digital platform (carioca.rio).
  [1]   *   Navigate to the "Ve√≠culo e Estacionamento" (Vehicle and Parking) section and select "Cart√£o de Estacionamento do Idoso".
    [1] *   Fill out the personal information form.
    [1] *   The applicant can choose to print the card directly from the website or pick it up at designated service points.
    [1] *   The system allows up to three attempts for printing the card.

2. [1]  **In-Person at SMTR Service Points:**
    *   Applications can also be submitted in person at the service points of the Secretaria Municipal de Transportes (SMTR).
    [1] *   Required documentation typically includes:
        *   A completed application form (Requerimento ao Coordenador da Coordenadoria de Regulamenta√ß√£o e Infra√ß√µes Vi√°rias da SMTR).
         [1]*   A simple copy of the applicant's official identification document with a photo and signature, including their CPF number.
         [1]*   A simple copy of a recent proof of residence in the applicant's name.
    *   For [1] in-person requests, the card is usually delivered within 10 days.

**Card Usage [2] and Benefits:**
The "Cart√£o de Estacionamento para Idoso" allows for the free use of designated parking spaces in public areas within the Rio Rotativo system. In private [1] establishments such as shopping malls, the card grants access to preferential parking spots but does not exempt the user from payment. The card is [2] not linked to a specific vehicle and can be used in any car as long as the elderly person is present. The card must [3] be displayed visibly on the vehicle's dashboard or windshield when parked in a designated elderly spot.

**Duplicate [3] Cards and Renewals:**
A second copy of the card can be requested in cases of loss, theft, or damage, typically requiring a police report (Boletim de Ocorr√™ncia) for theft or a declaration of loss. Renewals should [1] be requested at least 30 days before the card's expiration date.

**Important [4] Notes:**
*   Each CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas F√≠sicas) can only be used to issue one parking card for the elderly.
*   All cards [2] feature a QR Code, which enhances transparency and allows for public verification of the card's validity.
*   The card [2] is intended for the sole use of the cardholder. Misuse of the [4] card may result in penalties.
*   The card [2] is valid nationwide.
*   Recent updates [1] indicate that the digital version of the parking credential is now available through the Carteira Digital de Tr√¢nsito (CDT) app and the Senatran Portal, with the digital credential being valid throughout Brazil and potentially lifelong for seniors. However, specific [3] instructions for Rio de Janeiro's digital issuance via Carioca Digital are also prominent.

**Relevant Legislation [1]:**
The issuance and use of the "Cart√£o de Estacionamento para Idoso" are governed by Municipal Law No. 5.477 of July 4, 2012, Article 1 of Municipal Law No. 5.947 of September 16, 2015, and SMTR Resolution No. 2.881 of July 7, 2017. [4]

**Sources:**

## Pesquisa de Recurso de Multa de Tr√¢nsito no Rio de Janeiro

A interposi√ß√£o de recurso contra multas de tr√¢nsito no Rio de Janeiro pode ser realizada tanto para multas emitidas pelo munic√≠pio (Secretaria Municipal de Transportes - SMTR) quanto pelo Departamento Estadual de Tr√¢nsito (DETRAN-RJ). Os procedimentos e documentos necess√°rios podem variar ligeiramente entre os dois √≥rg√£os.

### Procedimentos para Recurso de Multas Municipais (Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro / SMTR)

A Secretaria Municipal de Transportes (SMTR) oferece diferentes canais para a apresenta√ß√£o de recursos e defesas. As op√ß√µes incluem o portal Carioca Digital, e-mail e, em alguns casos, atendimento presencial.

*   **Defesa [1] Pr√©via e Recurso em 1¬™ Inst√¢ncia:** Podem ser realizados digitalmente atrav√©s do portal Carioca Digital, onde o cidad√£o deve fazer login, selecionar a infra√ß√£o e apresentar a defesa ou recurso. Para infra√ß√µes cometidas [2] a partir de 01 de maio de 2023, o processo √© feito pelo portal Carioca Digital. Para infra√ß√µes anteriores [3] a 30 de abril de 2023, o envio de documenta√ß√£o pelos Correios para a sede da SMTR tamb√©m √© uma op√ß√£o.
*   **E-mail:** A SMTR tamb√©m [3] aceita requerimentos pelo e-mail `multas.smtr@gmail.com` para Defesa Pr√©via e Cancelamento de Multa, mediante o envio dos documentos necess√°rios.
*   **Atendimento Presencial:** Para [1] cancelamento de multa, o pedido deve ser protocolado presencialmente em postos descentralizados da SMTR. Para restitui√ß√£o de valores pagos, o atendimento √© no protocolo central da SMTR.

**Documenta√ß√£o Geralmente Necess√°ria [2] para Recursos Municipais:**
*   Requerimento de Recurso (modelo dispon√≠vel para download).
*   C√≥pia da Notifica√ß√£o de Autua√ß√£o ou [2] Auto de Infra√ß√£o, ou documento emitido pela SMTR que conste a placa e o n√∫mero do auto de infra√ß√£o.
*   Certificado de Registro e Licenciamento do Ve√≠culo [2] (CRLV).

### Procedimentos para Recurso de Multas do DETRAN-RJ

O DETRAN [2]-RJ permite a interposi√ß√£o de recursos em tr√™s etapas: Defesa Pr√©via, Recurso em Primeira Inst√¢ncia (junto √† Junta Administrativa de Recursos de Infra√ß√µes - JARI) e Recurso em Segunda Inst√¢ncia (junto ao Conselho Estadual de Tr√¢nsito - CETRAN). O processo pode ser iniciado online ou presencialmente.

**Documenta√ß√£o Geralmente [4] Necess√°ria para Recursos do DETRAN-RJ:**

### Modelo [4] de Carta para Recurso de Multa [4] de Tr√¢nsito (Municipal)

Anexo a este requerimento, documentos que comprovam as alega√ß√µes apresentadas."

**DOCUMENTOS ANEXOS:**

**PEDIDO:**

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact: Reporting Illegally Parked Vehicles in Rio de Janeiro**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

To report a vehicle parked illegally in Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels managed by the city government. The primary entity responsible for enforcing parking regulations and responding to such complaints is the Guarda Municipal (Municipal Guard) [1].

**Methods for Reporting:**

1.  **Central de Atendimento 1746:** This is the main point of contact for reporting parking violations. Citizens can reach the service via:
    *   **Telephone:** Dialing 1746 within the municipality of Rio de Janeiro, or (21) 3460-1746 from other locations. Calls to these numbers are charged at the rate of a fixed-line call [2].
    *   **WhatsApp:** Sending a message to (21) 3460-1746 [2].
    *   **1746 Mobile Application:** A smartphone application available for both Android and iOS systems allows users to submit requests, often including photos of the offending vehicle [1].
    *   **Online Portals:** Requests can also be made through the official portals 1746.rio and carioca.rio [2].
    *   **Administrative Regions:** If other means are unavailable, citizens can report through their local Administrative Region [2].

**Information Required for a Report:**

To ensure effective action, the following details should be provided when making a report:
*   The complete address of the occurrence, including the street name and number, along with any relevant reference points [2].
*   The license plate number of the illegally parked vehicle, if possible [2].
*   A description of the vehicle [2].
*   A clear indication of where the vehicle is parked [2].
*   Citizens are encouraged to photograph the offending vehicle and submit these images along with their request [1].

**Enforcement and Response:**

Upon receiving a report, the Guarda Municipal aims to dispatch a patrol vehicle to the location. The typical response time for the finalization of the service is within two hours [3]. In some instances, the response time has been reported as up to four hours [1], with efforts made to reduce this to 30 minutes using motorcycles for faster initial response [4]. Once at the scene, if the violation is confirmed, the vehicle may be fined and, in some cases, towed [1].

**Types of Violations Covered:**

The service addresses various forms of illegal parking, including but not limited to:
*   Vehicles parked in front of garages [1].
*   Vehicles parked on sidewalks [1].
*   Vehicles parked in improper locations [1].
*   Parking in designated spots for the elderly or people with disabilities without the proper card [2].
*   Parking in bus stops, bike lanes, or bus-only lanes [2].
*   Parking in areas prohibited by signage [2].
*   Double parking [2].
*   Parking near street corners, pedestrian crossings, or on central medians [2].

**Exclusions from Service:**

The service for reporting illegally parked vehicles does not apply to certain categories of vehicles when they are in active service. These include ambulances, fire trucks, police cars, municipal guard vehicles, and any vehicles with activated rotating lights (e.g., CET-Rio, Light, CEG) [2]. Additionally, vehicles parked on expressways such as Avenida Brasil, Linha Vermelha, Linha Amarela, and Ponte Rio-Niter√≥i are not covered by this specific reporting service. [3]

The reporting of illegally parked vehicles is consistently one of the most frequent requests received by the 1746 service, highlighting its importance to the city's residents. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [rio.rj.gov.br](http://www.rio.rj.gov.br/dlstatic/10112/4296177/4107216/ESTACIONAMENTOIRREGULAR.pdf)
 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/fiscalizacao-de-estacionamento-irregular-de-veiculo/)
 - [3] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10220543556763-Fiscaliza%C3%A7%C3%A3o-de-estacionamento-irregular-de-ve%C3%ADculo)
 - [4] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/sections/10220514636571-Estacionamento-Irregular)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** Denunciar carro abandonado prefeitura rio de janeiro

To report an abandoned vehicle in the city of Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize the official channels provided by the municipality. The primary platform for such service requests is the Portal Rio 1746, which can be accessed via telephone, the 1746 Rio application, or the portal itself at www.1746.rio [1]. The Secretaria Municipal de Ordem P√∫blica (SEOP) is involved in the removal of abandoned vehicles, often in conjunction with the Guarda Municipal. [2]

**Procedure for Reporting:**
To initiate a report, the following information is typically required:
*   Full address of the abandoned vehicle's location, including reference points. [2]
*   Characteristics of the abandoned vehicle, such as model, license plate (if visible), and its apparent condition. [2]
*   The duration the vehicle has been in that location. [2]

**Vehicle Condition for Removal:**
A vehicle will be considered for removal if it exhibits at least one of the following characteristics:
*   Signs of collision and/or vandalism. [3]
*   Evident state of decomposition of its bodywork and removable parts, including at least two deflated tires. [3]
*   Broken windows. [3]
*   Absence of at least one identification plate. [3]

Vehicles that are in normal working condition, with all wheels, windows, and bodywork in good state, and are parked irregularly, should be reported through the "Fiscaliza√ß√£o de estacionamento irregular" service. Vehicles [3] considered irreparable or scrap metal, lacking identification plates and significantly damaged, are handled by COMLURB (Companhia Municipal de Limpeza Urbana) under a different service.

 [3]**Response Time:**
The expected timeframe for the removal of an abandoned vehicle is up to 15 calendar days.

 [2]**Relevant Legislation:**
The process is governed by municipal laws, including:
*   Lei n¬∫ 5.301 of September 28, 2011, which addresses the removal of abandoned vehicles from public roads in the Municipality.
*  [2]  Decreto n¬∫ 36.805 of February 27, 2013, which details the removal of scrapped or abandoned vehicles from the city's public spaces.

It [2] is important to note that while some sources mention the Civil Police or calling 190 for abandoned cars in Rio de Janeiro, the official municipal channels like 1746 are the designated points of contact for reporting abandoned vehicles to the city hall for removal. The [2] Secretaria Municipal de Ordem P√∫blica (SEOP) is the responsible municipal body for these actions. [2]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [1746.rio](https://www.1746.rio/hc/pt-br/articles/10221186863003-Remo%C3%A7%C3%A3o-de-ve%C3%ADculo-abandonado-em-via-p%C3%BAblica)
 - [2] [grupoab.com.br](https://www.grupoab.com.br/blog/noticias/tem-um-carro-abandonado-na-minha-rua,-o-que-eu-faco/)

tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** How to report a broken traffic signal to the Rio de Janeiro city hall.

To report a broken traffic signal to the Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro, citizens can utilize several official channels. The primary method is through the 1746 service, which is a central point of contact for various municipal services. This can be accessed via the 1746 phone number, the 1746 Rio mobile application (available for Android and iOS), or through the official website www.1746.rio [1]. Additionally, reporting can be done via WhatsApp at (21) 3460-1746 [1].

When reporting a broken traffic signal, it is important to provide specific details to facilitate the repair process. This includes the names of the streets at the intersection where the signal is malfunctioning, or the name of the street if it is not an intersection. Providing reference points such as nearby numbers, schools, or gas stations is also helpful. It is also necessary to specify whether the entire intersection is out of order, or if it is a single lamp that is not working [1]. The expected timeframe for the repair of a broken traffic signal is typically within 24 hours [1].

Historically, the "Disque-sinal" service was available via the phone number 2508-5500 for reporting defects such as intermittent lights, burnt-out bulbs, or damaged signals [2]. While this number is mentioned in older documentation, the current primary channels appear to be the 1746 service and its associated platforms [1].

For issues that are not resolved through the 1746 service or if there are concerns about the quality or timeliness of the response, the Ouvidoria (Ombudsman) can be contacted. The Companhia de Engenharia de Tr√°fego (CET-Rio) has an Ouvidoria that can be reached through the 1746 channels or directly via their portal for specific traffic engineering matters. tool_return.text:
**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** Solicitar quebra-mola (speed bump) from the Rio de Janeiro City Hall.

To request the installation of a speed bump (quebra-mola) in Rio de Janeiro, citizens must follow a specific procedure that involves the municipal government's traffic and public works departments. The process generally begins with a formal request submitted by the community or a representative.

**Procedure for Requesting a Speed Bump:**

1.  **Formal Request:** The request must be made by a representative of the local community. This representative should provide their full name, contact information (phone, email), and proof of residence in the area where the speed bump is requested, such as a utility bill [1].
2.  **Community Support:** An original petition signed by at least two-thirds of the residential units on the street where the speed bump is to be installed is required. The petition must include legible names and addresses of the signatories [1].
3.  **Police Clearance:** An original document stating "NADA OPOR" (no objection) from the Military Police Battalion with jurisdiction over the area is necessary [1].
4.  **Submission:** The request, along with the supporting documents, should be submitted to the relevant Subprefeitura (Sub-prefecture) of the area [1]. Alternatively, requests can be formalized through the 1746 service or the Carioca Digital portal [1].

**Evaluation and Implementation Process:**

*   **CET-Rio Evaluation:** The request is initially directed to CET-Rio (Companhia de Engenharia de Tr√°fego do Rio de Janeiro), which is responsible for evaluating the need and feasibility of the speed bump. [1] This evaluation includes assessing traffic volume, accident risks, and urbanistic factors. [1]
*   **Project Development and Approval:** If the request is approved by CET-Rio, a project is developed. This may involve the publication of a portaria (ordinance) authorizing its construction. [1]

tool_return.text:
### Research Artifact: Online Traffic Accident Registration in Rio de Janeiro

**Date of Search:** 2025-08-09

**Research Topic:** registro de acidente de tr√¢nsito online Rio de Janeiro

**Summary:**

In Rio de Janeiro, the online registration of traffic accidents without victims is facilitated through the e-BRAT system, a web-based tool managed by the State Military Police (PMERJ). [1] This system allows citizens involved in traffic accidents without injuries to submit information online for validation and subsequent issuance of a Boletim de Registro de Acidente de Tr√¢nsito (BRAT).
 [1]
**Key Information and Procedures:**

*   **System:** The e-BRAT (Boletim de Registro de Acidente de Tr√¢nsito) system is the designated platform for online registration of traffic accidents that do not involve any victims.
* [1]   **Eligibility:** The service is available to all residents of the State of Rio de Janeiro who were involved in an accident that did not result in injuries and occurred on a state road.
* [2]   **Accessing the Service:** To register an accident, users must access the e-BRAT website at http://ebrat.pmerj.rj.gov.br/brat/.
* [2]   **Process:**
    1.  Access the e-BRAT website and agree to the instructions.
  [2]   2.  Fill out the form with details related to the accident to initiate the registration.
  [2]   3.  The system allows for the registration of accidents involving up to four vehicles.
  [3]   4.  Information such as vehicle license plates, Renavam numbers, vehicle types, and state of origin are required.
  [3]   5.  Details about the accident dynamics, location (e.g., intersection, rotatory), visibility, and type of accident must be provided.
  [3]   6.  Users can attach photos of the accident.
  [3]   7.  The system allows for the option to receive the registration protocol number via email for tracking.
* [3]   **Timeframe for Registration:** Citizens have up to 90 days after the accident to complete the e-BRAT registration.
* [2]   **Cost:** The e-BRAT service is free of charge.
* [2]   **Consultation:** The e-BRAT system also allows users to consult previously submitted accident reports using a protocol number. The [3] consultation service is available online 24 hours a day.
* [3]   **Limitations:** The e-BRAT system is exclusively for accidents without victims and those occurring on state roads. Accidents with victims require seeking the nearest police station, and accidents on federal highways fall under the jurisdiction of the Federal Highway Police. The [2] system also cannot process accidents involving more than five vehicles.

 [4]**Official Sources:**

*   The e-BRAT system is managed by the Secretaria de Estado de Pol√≠cia Militar (State Military Police).
*  [1]  Information is also available through the Governo do Estado do Rio de Janeiro portal.
*  [2]  The Carioca Digital portal also references the e-BRAT system for accident registration.
*  [4]  The Pol√≠cia Civil (Civil Police) also has a "Delegacia Online" for pre-registration of occurrences, but for traffic accidents with victims, it directs users to the nearest police station or to the e-BRAT site for accidents without victims. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [sepm.rj.gov.br](https://sepm.rj.gov.br/e-brat/)
 - [2] [www.rj.gov.br](https://www.rj.gov.br/servico/fazer-o-boletim-de-registro-de-acidente-de-transito-sem-vitimas-e-brat159)
 - [3] [www.rj.gov.br](https://www.rj.gov.br/servico/consultar-boletim-de-registro-de-acidente-de-transito-sem-vitimas-e-brat48)
 - [4] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/solicitacao-de-emissao-de-brat-em-acidente-de-transito-sem-vitima/)

**Research Artifact**

**Date of Search:** August 9, 2025

**Research Topic:** Authorization requirements for school vans (van escolar) in Rio de Janeiro.

To obtain authorization for operating a school van in Rio de Janeiro, operators must meet several requirements related to the vehicle, the driver, and the operational procedures, as mandated by the Municipal Secretariat of Transport (SMTR) [1]. The process involves credencing both the vehicle and the driver, with mandatory vehicle inspections conducted every six months [1].

**Vehicle Requirements:**
*   **Identification:** Vehicles must have a red license plate and a yellow stripe, 40 cm wide, along the entire length of the sides and rear, with the word "ESCOLAR" in black [1]. The authorization number must be visibly fixed on the vehicle, along with an annual inspection sticker and an identification card for the authorized operator/auxiliary displayed on the windshield [1].
*   **Documentation:**
    *   Certificate of Registration and Licensing of the Vehicle (CRLV) must be up-to-date [1].
    *   If the vehicle has undergone modifications, a Vehicle Safety Certificate (CSV) is required [2].
    *   Proof of ownership, such as the CRLV or an invoice in the company's name, is necessary. For leased vehicles, a copy of the leasing contract is required [2].
    *   A copy of the civil liability insurance policy in the company's name is mandatory, covering death per passenger (R$ 5,000.00 or total capacity), permanent disability per passenger (R$ 5,000.00 or total capacity), and material damage (minimum R$ 25,000.00) [2]. For individuals, the insurance must be in their name with similar coverage [2].
    *   Proof of payment of the vehicle's mandatory insurance (DPVAT) is required [3].
    *   For companies, proof of at least 50% of the share capital integration in relation to the fleet is needed [2].
    *   A declaration of the vehicle's storage location, on company letterhead, is required [2].
*   **Inspection:** Vehicles are subject to mandatory inspections every six months to verify safety items, including the tachograph [1]. For the inspection, a vistoria appointment confirmation, proof of payment for the Municipal Collection Document (DARM), an updated tachograph calibration certificate, and a regularized cadastral status report are needed [1].

**Driver and Auxiliary Requirements:**
*   **Driver's License:** The driver must possess a National Driver's License (CNH) in Category D, which must be valid and indicate that the driver engages in remunerated activity [1]. The minimum age for drivers is 21 years [4].
*   **Training:** A certificate of completion for a specialized course in school transportation is required for the authorized operator/permissionary and any auxiliaries [1].
*   **Criminal Records:** Original negative certificates from the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th Criminal Distribution Registry Offices are required, with a maximum of 90 days from the application date [2]. A certificate of no record from the Federal Justice is also necessary [2].
*   **Health:** A medical certificate stating the absence of infectious diseases is required [2].
*   **Auxiliary Personnel:** If an auxiliary is employed, their identification card must be displayed with the windshield [1]. For the removal of an auxiliary, specific documentation and procedures must be followed at SMTR protocol centers [4].

**Operational and Legal Requirements:**
*   **Authorization:** The process for obtaining authorization is managed by the Municipal Secretariat of Transport (SMTR) [1]. Applications can be initiated through the Carioca Digital Portal or by contacting the 1746 service [2].
*   **Regulations:** The service is governed by various decrees and resolutions, including Decree Rio No. 38.363/2014, which establishes the regulations for school transportation services in Rio de Janeiro [2]. A proposed bill (PL n¬∫ 817/2025) aims to consolidate and update these rules for greater safety and efficiency. [1]
*   **Fines and Penalties:** Vehicles must not have overdue fines, which must be settled before the inspection. [3] The SMTR monitors infractions, and accumulating points can lead to suspension and mandatory retraining. [5] Transporting students in unaccredited vehicles is considered clandestine and subject to immediate vehicle removal and fines. [1]
*   **Vehicle Capacity:** Vehicles must have a minimum capacity of eight passengers, and the service can be offered via buses, minibuses, and other vehicles meeting these criteria. [1]

For specific inquiries or to initiate the process, citizens can contact the 1746 service or visit the relevant sections of the Prefeitura do Rio de Janeiro's official websites. [1]

**Sources:**
 - [1] [prefeitura.rio](https://transportes.prefeitura.rio/transporte-escolar/)
 - [2] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/servicos/autorizacao-para-transporte-escolar-abertura-de-termo/)
 - [3] [carioca.rio](https://carioca.rio/grupo/permissao-de-transporte-escolar/)
 - [4] [starcorretoradeseguros.com.br](https://starcorretoradeseguros.com.br/o-que-precisa-para-dirigir-van-escolar-veja-os-requisitos/)
